questions.text: A change that modifies a risk control measure is classified as:

options.explanation: Changes affecting risk controls are always classified as major.
Per Section 5.2, any change involving new or modified risk controls is classified as a major change.
Emergency is not a classification in this SOP; changes are major or minor.
Classification follows defined criteria, not individual judgment.

questions.text: What is the minimum verification requirement for a minor change?

options.explanation: All changes require at least unit testing and regression testing.
Per Section 5.6, minor changes require unit testing (required) and regression testing.
Full system testing is required for major changes, not minor ones.
Design review is not required for minor changes; testing is.

questions.text: A UI text correction with no safety impact requires cross-functional review board approval.
questions.explanation: Per Section 5.2, documentation corrections and UI-only changes with no safety impact are classified as minor changes. Cross-functional review board approval is only required for major changes.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a valid source for a change request?

options.explanation: CAPA outcomes are a valid source per Section 5.1.
Customer feedback is a valid source per Section 5.1.
Change requests must originate from defined sources: CAPA, feedback, regulatory changes, PMS findings, improvement initiatives, or security vulnerabilities.
Security vulnerabilities are a valid source per Section 5.1.

questions.text: What additional step is required for major changes that is not required for minor changes?

options.explanation: Both major and minor changes involve implementation.
Per Section 5.6, major changes require regulatory assessment, while minor changes do not.
Both types of changes use feature branches.
Unit tests are required for both major and minor changes.
